    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(int delta)
        Steps the physics simulation by the specified timestep
        Parameters:
        delta - the timestep

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the basic objects needed for the functioning of the PhysicsHandler object

      • makePlayer

        public PhysPlayer makePlayer(int n,
                    float[] p,
                    java.lang.String user)
        Creates a player body with the specified properties, adds in to the physics engine, and returns it to the calling statement.
        Parameters:
        n - The ID of the player being created, used to identify the player object
        p - The position at which the player is being created
        user - The player's username, used to identify the player object
        Returns:
        Returns the PhysPlayer object created to the calling statement

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(KeyMessage msg)
        Moves the player specified by the KeyMessage in the manner specified in the KeyMessage.
        Parameters:
        msg - The KeyMessage object containing the data specifying how the player should be moved

      • getPlayerWithName

        public PhysPlayer getPlayerWithName(java.lang.String user)
        Retrieves the player with the specified name from the server's storage.
        Parameters:
        user - The username of the player that is being fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the player found, or null if no match is found

      • getBlockUpdates

        public Block[] getBlockUpdates()
        Creates and returns an array of blocks corresponding to the position of blocks on the server. This method is called with the purpose of sending the blocks to the client as an update.
        Returns:
        Returns the Block[] containing the block updates.

      • makeBlock

        public void makeBlock(Block block)
        Adds the block received to the game's physics engine.
        Parameters:
        block - The block to add.

      • getPlayerUpdates

        public Message[] getPlayerUpdates()
        Creates and returns an array of Message objects corresponding to the position of players on the server. This method is called with the purpose of sending the Messages to the client as an update.
        Returns:
        Returns the array of Message updates

      • addMap

        public void addMap(Map map)
        Adds a map to the server's ArrayList of loaded maps. If the server does not already have this map loaded, this method will load all the blocks contained by the map into the game's physics engine.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to be added.

      • enQueue

        public void enQueue(java.lang.Object o)
        Queues an object received by the input stream to be processed.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to be added to the queue.
